definition: shield/(currency) Vietnamese dong/currency unit of several countries (Indonesian rupiah, Dutch gulden etc)

sentences.english: However, when different factions jockey fiercely for power, the support of the military is crucial.
sentences.chinese: 但不同黨羽爭權奪利時，有軍隊做後盾就很關鍵。

sentences.english: Provide the strong backing for the company and the general merchants.
sentences.chinese: 爲公司與廣大客商提供堅強的後盾。

sentences.english: He had little difficulty in talking the slanderer down.
sentences.chinese: 他以事實和數字爲後盾毫不費力地駁倒了誹謗者。

sentences.chinese: 無鉛波峯焊接製程的堅強後盾。

sentences.english: "You've seen gold replacing these currencies as safety instruments, " Zeman said.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，“黃金正在取代這些貨幣成爲安全後盾。

sentences.english: There is a long history of companies pushing banks to stand behind their deals.

sentences.english: Neighbours wonder whether claims will one day be backed with force.
sentences.chinese: 衆鄰國擔心是否某天主權主張會以武力作爲後盾。

sentences.english: During this time, family can offer you the most solid support you will need, so take advantage of it.
sentences.chinese: 這段時間，家人是你艱強的後盾，好好利用。

sentences.english: But this is combined with an extremely strong and ubiquitous state.
sentences.chinese: 但這也是在一個極強大和無處不在的國家做後盾。

sentences.english: Most companies that issue bonds in China are government-backed.

sentences.english: He also backs the independence of the breakaway Georgian regions of Abkhazia and South Ossetia.
sentences.chinese: 他也是格魯吉亞獨立地區阿布哈茲和南奧塞梯的後盾。

definition: variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
to pave (with paving stones)/to lay a road/(fig.) to lay the groundwork (for sth)/to give a present to sb to ensure success
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
